intro: Omphalospora praecox, commonly known as the early bladdergrass, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its small, spike-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, white to pale blue flowers. Omphalospora praecox is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
